newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia in 100 mln Ecu GSM 1800 system deal.
newsitem.headline: Nokia in 100 mln Ecu GSM 1800 system deal.

text.p: Finnish telecoms group Nokia Oy said on Thursday it signed a letter of intent to supply a complete GSM 1800 turn-key system to Cosmote, a joint venture between the Greek PTT and Telenor of Norway.
"The value of the contract is approximately 100 million Ecus and covers deliveries for the next two years," Nokia said in a statement.
Nokia said it would be the sole GSM network supplier to Cosmote.
"This is a significant deal for Nokia, being the first GSM system deal in Greece," it said.
The complete network solution will include the supply of high-capacity mobile switching centres, base station subsystems and compact base stations.
The network would be fully operational by the end of this year, Nokia said. The first phase of the Cosmote network would provide services for Athens and Thessaloniki as well as the area of Patra.
